Description: Lip and body sherd (mended from two fragments, one erroneously re-registered as 1924,1201.113) of East Greek (South Ionian) pottery plate; gritty clay with much silver mica; white slip, dark brown paint; exterior: three bands on slipped ground; interior: hook maeander frieze on rim; lotus flower and bud frieze between broad bands on outer floor; to centre, maeander hooks between dilute lines; drill hole on broken edge for analysis.
Curator's comments: For the lotus blossom and bud frieze compare Cook 1933-1934, fig. 13, no. 7 (Fikellura); see also R. M. Cook and P. Dupont, East Greek Pottery (London-New York 1998), p. 46, fig. 8.13, 3 (Fikellura). See also R. Attula, 'Archaic Greek Plates from the Apollo Sanctuary at Emecik, Knidia: results and Questions Concerning Dorian Pottery Production,' in A. Villing and U. Schlotzhauer (eds.), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt: Studies on East Greek Pottery and Exchange in the Eastern Mediterranean (London 2006), p. 89, fig. 14, p. 90, Cat. no. 11. Joins BM 1924,0119.1113.

Analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen, sample Nauk 8 (forms a pair with sample Emec 31)- cf. R. Attula, "Archaic Greek Plates from the Apollo Sanctuary at Emecik, Knidia. Results and Questions Concerning Dorian Pottery Production", in A. Villing & U. Schlotzhauer (eds.), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt. Studies on East Greek pottery and exchange in the Eastern Mediterranean (British Museum Research Publication 162; London: British Museum, 2006), p. 89-90, cat. no. 11, fig. 14; Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006, p. 56.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 6)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 56 Table 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.910)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 151-2, Nau 121, pl. 26e-f)
